questions.question: Both of us ……………………….. present there.
questions.description: Both of us is a plural expression hence, the verb has to be in the plural form.

questions.question: All of my friends ………………………… been invited to my party.
questions.description: Use a plural verb after all.

questions.question: Each one of these apples …………………………….. ripe.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after each.

questions.question: She and I ………………………….. working on a new project.
questions.description: She and I is a plural expression.

questions.question: Neither red nor black …………………………… me.
questions.description: When we connect two singular subjects with neither/nor, the verb is singular.

questions.question: Either Rita or Janet ……………………………. eaten the ice-cream.
questions.description: When we connect two singular subjects with either/or, the verb is singular.

questions.question: Neither my father nor my mother ……………………………. going to the party.
questions.description: When we connect two singular subjects with neither/nor, the verb is singular.

questions.question: Either you or I ………………………………… in the wrong.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with either/or, the verb agrees in number and person with the subject closest to it.

questions.question: No news ……………………………….. bad news.
questions.description: News is uncountable in English. It is used with a singular noun.

questions.question: None of the boys ………………………………. wearing a cap.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after none of.

questions.question: Neither James nor his colleagues …………………………….. in the office.
questions.description: When we connect a singular and a plural noun with neither/nor, the verb agrees with the noun closest to it.

questions.question: My trousers ……………………………… blue in colour.
questions.description: Use a plural verb with jeans, trousers, pants, scissors etc.
